desc.title: expected:operation:initializer
desc.description: this is the description of Expected Operator Initializer

operators.title: expected:equals
operators.description:
* Checks a value for equality
* It's default operator, in case of no defined operator

examples.title: Checks the response status of an rest call

operators.title: expected:equals:not
operators.description: It's the not extension of the '<ref:expected:equals>' operator

operators.title: expected:equals:ci
operators.description: It's the ci (case insensitive) extension of the '<ref:expected:equals>' operator

operators.title: expected:equals:ci:not
operators.description: It's the not extension of the '<ref:expected:equals:ci>' operator

operators.title: expected
operators.description:
The '<ref:expected:equals>' operator it's the default
operator and it's used when no operator is defined

operators.title: expected:not
operators.description: It's the not extension of the '<ref:expected:equals:default>' operator

operators.title: expected:ci
operators.description: It's the ci (case insensitive) extension of the '<ref:expected:equals:default>' operator

operators.title: expected:ci:not
operators.description: It's the not extension of the '<ref:expected:equals:default:ci>' operator
